snippet: The decision was an unexpected setback for American Airlines’ parent, the AMR Corporation, in its quest to save more than $1 billion a year in labor costs.
abstract: Federal Judge Sean H Lane denies a request by American Airlines' parent, AMR Corp, to abandon collective bargaining agreements with its pilots' union Allied Pilots Assn, an unexpected decision and setback for the bankrupt company in its quest to save more than $1 billion a year in labor costs.
lead_paragraph: The decision was an unexpected setback for American Airlines’ parent, the AMR Corporation, in its quest to save more than $1 billion a year in labor costs.

headline.seo: AMR Is Denied a Request to Cancel Pilots’ Contract
headline.main: Airline Loses Bid to End Pilot Contract
headline.print_headline: Airline Loses Bid to End Pilot Contract
